# Draft:Splitting (cooking)

Splitting or breaking is a type of curdling of food, primarily experienced by sauces and similar dishes under high heat. It occurs as a result of overcooking and is considered fatal for the quality of a dish, though techniques to "repair" splitting exist, while variants of some dishes may be designed specifically not to split. Frequently affected foods include Bechamel sauce, tomato sauce, and cheese.
